section.title: payments selection of Select Payments
section.para: Before you can pay a Vendor an amount due, you must first select the relevant A/P open item(s) for payment. A/P open items are generated by the posting of Vouchers and miscellaneous A/P Debit Memos. To select an A/P open item for payment, choose the "Select Payments" option. The following screen will appear:

tip.para: You may select multiple Vouchers for payment by using the SHIFT or CTRL keys and your mouse.

section.para: When selecting A/P open items for payment, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Select one of the following display options:
Select to show A/P open items for all Vendors.
Specify Vendor whose A/P open items you want to display.
Specify Vendor Type whose A/P open items you want to display.
Enter a Vendor Type pattern to select a range of Vendor Types. Refine your search using Regular Expressions, as described in .
Select one of the following display options:
Select to show all A/P open items for all due dates.
Select to show A/P open items whose due date is older than the date entered.
Select to show A/P open items whose due date falls within a specified range.

note.para: When a Check is created to satisfy an A/P open item, the value displayed in the amount due column will be adjusted automatically to reflect the Check amount. For example, if a Check is issued for the full amount due, the value in the amount due column will adjust to "0". Once a Check for the full amount is posted, the A/P open item will be removed from the Select Payments list altogether.

listitem.para: Display lists A/P open items. If a Document is past due, the line for that Document will display in red type.

tip.para: Be alert to negative balances in the amount due column. A negative balance indicates that Checks have been issued for more than the amount due. To correct this situation, view your Check Run and void any superfluous Checks.

listitem.para: Specify the default Bank Account to be used whenever an A/P open item is selected for payment during the current session. If you do not use this default option, you must specify a Bank Account each time you select an A/P open item for payment.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen, returning you to the application desktop.
Runs the report associated with this screen.

Highlight an A/P open item and then click this button to manually review and select the Item for payment. This option brings you to the individual Select Payment screen, where you will find the full range of payment options.
Highlight an A/P open item and then click this button to automatically select the open item for payment. Any available Terms Discount will also be applied automatically.
Highlight an A/P open item and then select this button to clear the selected payment. This option effectively reverses the action of the SELECT option.
Select this button to select for payment all A/P open items whose payment date is due or past due.
Select this option to automatically select all A/P open items which are eligible for a Terms Discount. The Terms Discount will be applied automatically to all selected open items.
Select this button to clear all selected payments due. This option effectively reverses the action of the SELECT ALL DUE option.
